requiredInputs.model: The input model or models to the simulator.  Must be an internal reference to an input:models object, or to the output of another task that can produce a model (or models).
requiredInputs.initialTime: A double.  Required input to simulator, so it knows what the 'time' is for the input model as given.
requiredInputs.outputVariables: A list of strings.  Defines what output to collect from the simulator.  As such, some simulators may use it as input (as is the case for tellurium).

optionalInputs.outputStartTime: A double.  The first point at which data should be collected.
optionalInputs.outputEndTime: A double.  The final point at which data should be collected.
optionalInputs.numberOfSteps: A positive integer.  The number of time points after the first that should be collected.
optionalInputs.timeInterval: A double.  The size step to take after the outputStartTime.
optionalInputs.outputModel: A boolean.  True if some other process needs the model-at-the-end-of-the-simulation as its own input.  False if the model does not need to be stored.  (Maybe make this requried?)

uniformTimeCourse.Other vaidation rules: Exactly three of the optiona inputs outputStartTime, outputEndTime, numberOfSteps, and timeInterval must be defined.  The parameters of the time points will need to be provided to the simulator (i.e. 'r.simulate(0, 10, 100)' for roadrunner.

outputs.values: A matrix of doubles.  The dimensions of the matrix are: models by outputVariables by time points.  If only one model is used as input, the output is just a matrix of outputVariables by time points.  The outputVariables are the requried input, and the time points are determinable by the four inputs outputStartTime, outputEndTime, numberOfSteps, and timeInterval.  When used as input to other tasks or outputs, individual vectors of results for a single outputVariable may be obtained by asking for the id #tasks:timeCourseId[model#]['variableName'].  An example:  #tasks:sim1[0]['S1'].  If there is only one model input, the [model#] may be omitted, i.e. #tasks:sim1['S1'].
outputs.model: The model with its state as it is at the end of the simulation.  We know if we will need it if the 'outputModel' option is set.  Obtainable by asking for the id #tasks:timeCourseId:model, i.e. #tasks:sim1:model

uniformTimeCourse.other notes: Some systems do not have to simulate across time, but can use other variables, like space (CellML does this, and has been making due with SED-ML requiring time, but would probably like to not have to do this.  It might be time to explicitly define an independent variable for this construct, instead of assuming it's time.
